posts.post_content: Correction, the thing making her very playable is jaya ballard who discards to your graveyard for use of one of 3 burn abilities. However, I still prefer the previous version, why? To use this one I have to stack my deck with enough of specific cards to make her ability count, and then she may never get to use it. Chandra nalaar only needs herself, has pretty solid abilities even if you don't use her ultimate, and her ultimate is still devastating. This one is good too, but its far more dependent on the lay out of a deck, much like nissa is, if you don't have any nissa's chosen for example.. well tough luck.

posts.post_content:
the only thing actually making her playable is [Pyromancer's Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyromancer's Ascension). at least you only need to keep her alive for 4 turns to win  
  
edit: yes [Jaya Ballard, Task Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jaya Ballard, Task Mage) is helpful to Chandra, but i was walking about her playability in limited and standard, where only the ascension can help her. i cant honestly see any truely good decks being made in Zendikar limited, its not a set designed to be played alone from what i have scene. there are a few gems, but most of them are just useless or weak. i mean, the best non-broken card i have scene is [Obsidian Fireheart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obsidian Fireheart). that isnt to say there arent good cards in the block, they are all just so easy to break decks with, expecially since the "land matters" theme of the block is obviously a strong indication of the best decks should be mono colored.  
  
Maybe a gimp to the cardpool because of Timespiral/Shadowmoor/Lorwyn standard? i know i have some devestating cards from those blocks, but... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Ava_Adore (11/8/2009 4:48:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Nalaar is better if you want a red planeswalker  
  
Nalaar's +1 ability is a bit lackluster, but it does clock your opponent. the -X is the key feature, letting you burn out a bunch of little creatures or take out just about any fatty. The ultimate is very game-breaking, which gives your opponents a lot of urgency to kill her, getting damage off your dome or burning through their removal/counters. The biggest strength of Chandra though is that she can easily kill more than one creature or get damage off of you, which gives red a rare card advantage source. She functions very similar to Comet Storm, the new spoiled card that everyone is losing their panties over. She is very good in multiples too.  
  
Ablaze? The +1 ability is trash. You get a little bit more utility out of your burn spells, but why do you have burn spells in your hand on turn 6? If it could turn spare lands into burns, then it'd be good. But it does not. The ultimate is not as game-breaking as Nalaar's either, since ablaze's... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Rating:

posts.post_content: I don't know why everyone is saying Nalaar is better... i got Ablaze first and then i decided to have both in my burn deck. I really like Nalaar's ultimate but i've only used it once, whereas when i team up Ablaze with Squee its 4 damage no matter what each turn. I have two squees so odds are that i get one. i have a ton of volcanic hammers, shocks, a lava axe or two, and toss in an elemental appeal for an instant win as soon as i cast her ultimate. In a single turn, using Ablaze i've dealt 32 damage... while i love Nalaar, i don't think she can be considered better than Ablaze. Also @ whoever said they didn't like Sorin: what the hell? Sorin has one of the greatest ultimates ever. I've both used Sorin and had him used against me, and any time he comes out he wins.

posts.post_content:
I honestly don't think this card is that great; maybe okay late game, and by that point if you're playing red burn you should have won by then. Nalaar is cheaper and is better overall, and I don't like the fact you have to discard cards to up her counter. Since when does red have an abundance of cards to discard late game? I have yet to even see this being played.  
  
Her second ability is useless since Burning Inquiry costs R. I guess if you're playing tons of burn spells, and you make it to turn 8 without her getting hit, it's worth the finish. That actually sounds tempting now come to think of it lol.

Posted By: ScruffyNerfHearder (1/11/2010 12:55:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The closest thing to a Planeswalker for madness/threshold decks.
  
However my madness deck is red and black, so not as good as it could be.. but still very awesome.
  
It only lets me discard once per turn as a sorcery, and its ability only benefits red cards, but said ability does hit for 1/5th of your life!
  
Plus the added benefit that all planeswalkers give.... being a target that isn't you!
  
   
Flat out amazing for burn decks.
  
   
The potential to draw new cards is a nice touch too. As well as procing madness on everything.
